Package com.GiovanChristoffelSihombingJBusRS

Class Payment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.GiovanChristoffelSihombingJBusRS.dbjson.Serializable
      • com.GiovanChristoffelSihombingJBusRS.Invoice
        • com.GiovanChristoffelSihombingJBusRS.Payment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Serializable>
    public class Payment
extends Invoice
    The Payment class represents a payment made for a bus rental, including information such as the buyer ID, renter ID, bus ID, departure date, and bus seat.

      • availableSchedule

        public static Schedule availableSchedule​(java.sql.Timestamp departureSchedule,
                                         java.lang.String seat,
                                         Bus bus)
        The function `availableSchedule` returns the first schedule in a given bus that matches the departure schedule and has an available seat.
        Parameters:
        departureSchedule - The departure schedule is a timestamp that represents the desired departure time for the bus schedule.
        seat - The "seat" parameter is a String that represents the seat number or identifier.
        bus - The bus parameter is an object of the Bus class.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Schedule object.

      • availableSchedule

        public static Schedule availableSchedule​(java.sql.Timestamp departureSchedule,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> seats,
                                         Bus bus)
        The function `availableSchedule` returns the first schedule from a list of schedules that matches the given departure schedule and has available seats.
        Parameters:
        departureSchedule - The departure schedule is a timestamp indicating the date and time of the bus departure.
        seats - The `seats` parameter is a list of strings representing the seat numbers that you want to check for availability.
        bus - The "bus" parameter is an object of the Bus class. It represents a bus and contains information about its schedules and seats.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Schedule object.

      • makeBooking

        public static boolean makeBooking​(java.sql.Timestamp departureSchedule,
                                  java.lang.String seat,
                                  Bus bus)
        The function `makeBooking` checks if a seat is available on a specific bus schedule and books it if it is.
        Parameters:
        departureSchedule - The departure schedule is a Timestamp object that represents the date and time of the bus departure.
        seat - The seat parameter is a String that represents the seat number or identifier.
        bus - The bus parameter is an object of the Bus class.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if a booking is successfully made, and false otherwise.

      • makeBooking

        public static boolean makeBooking​(java.sql.Timestamp departureSchedule,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> seats,
                                  Bus bus)
        The function "makeBooking" checks if all the seats in a given list can be booked on a bus for a specific departure schedule.
        Parameters:
        departureSchedule - The departure schedule is a Timestamp object that represents the date and time of the bus departure.
        seats - A list of seat numbers that the user wants to book on the bus.
        bus - The bus object represents the bus for which the booking is being made. It contains information about the bus, such as its capacity, current bookings, and availability.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value.
